author: Staff Reporter
text:
The multi facility centenary building of the Coimbatore Medical College Hospital (CMCH) was inaugurated by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa through video conferencing on Tuesday. The five storied building on 3,23,477 sq ft was built at a cost of Rs. 64.36 crore.

The new building will house the speciality departments such as cardiology, cardio thoracic, neurosurgery, neurology, plastic surgery, medical and surgical gastroenterology, nephrology and urology.

The existing casualty, toxicology, intensive coronary care unit and intensive medical care unit will be shifted to the new building.

The centenary building would have trauma and orthopaedic wards in addition to the existing trauma and orthopaedic wards.
title: Centenary buildings opened
